answers.answer: Dizzyness sounds to me like you are low on iron.....And definitely could be due to the fever and flu.  Ask your doctor, I don't think you should be tooo concerned but definitely ask your Dr.
Mumita - Yeah, I will ask today. Thanks..I feel like a medhelp leper today.. No one responded to me.. =(Poor me! Hahaha! JUST KIDDING!
We all have those days where we're invisible.....Maybe if you post something like "OT: Baby-Daddy-Drama!" you'll get a million responses.
Your response was priceless!Laura, I am sorry you are not feeling well! Having the flu *****!! I just got my flu shot about an hour ago so I am hoping to keep the flu away!!!Feel better!xxx
Or.. "I'm having a hermaphrodite!"Ehh., something catchy?  =P

I didn't see you response until now but IF you are having a hermaphrodite, start painting the room Orange, that is gender neutral :P j/k.  I hope Jaxon is doing alright!I hope you are all feeling better today!

LauraB78,Ah, the page turning headliners. Anyway, It could be that you have a secondary infection such as an ear infection. That would cause dizziness too. But also, dizziness is normal in the later months because of our increased blood volume. It is very common when standing up quickly, getting out of a warm bath, etc. It can be worse because you have the flu too. One of the flu symptoms is dizziness. But let us know what the doc says. Oh, and keep hydrated as much as possible.
that symptom also has to do with blood pressure too!! So i would be careful...have you also been checked for diabetes yet?? i cant remember!

question: So, this is likely because I am sick right now anyway, but I was wondering if anyone else has experienced dizzyness around 31 weeks? I have been having it on and off for a couple days, but am just figuring I should chalk it up to a side effect of the flu.. Anyone think I should be more concerned? I luckily have a Dr. appt. today @ 4pm anyway so I will ask them as well but always appreciate the insight I get here on medhelp!
title: Dizzy - 31 weeks
